page.title: 13ABERDYFI INSHORE RESCUE BOAT
page.content: The inshore rescue boat stationed in Aberdyfi is an{Atlantic 21 type. This design is particularly suitable for use in dangerous estuary waters. The Dyfi estuary has an ebb tide capable of 7/8 knots.It is guarded by the dangerous Dyfi Bar and contains continually shifting sand banks. The Atlantic 21 is powered by two 60 horse power engines capable of 30 knots.It has a range of 90 nautical miles.The hull is made of glass reinforced plastic with neoprene tubes and if she should capsize she can be self righted. The weekly training exercise enables the public to see the boat launched from its trailer and put through its paces by a crew of three. At 1985 prices the Atlantic 21 costs approximately Â£29 000.
